summary: This is an automatic notification from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York regarding the case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It notes a temporary administrative reassignment of the case from Judge Nathan to Judge Broderick and back, and lists numerous attorneys and legal staff who were electronically notified of this docket remark.

events.title: Case Administrative Reassignment
events.description: The case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell was temporarily reassigned from Judge Alison J. Nathan to Judge Vernon S. Broderick due to an administrative error, and then returned to Judge Nathan.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is an automatic court notification regarding the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell (Case Number 1:20-cr-00330-AJN).
On April 1, 2022, the case was briefly reassigned from Judge Alison J. Nathan to Judge Vernon S. Broderick due to an administrative error before being returned to Judge Nathan.
The notice was electronically mailed to a extensive list of defense attorneys and U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors involved in the case.
The document does not contain substantive case details, only procedural administrative information about judicial assignment.
